name: nytimes
text:
Two lawyers were charged with taking part in a Molotov cocktail attack on a police patrol car over the weekend in Brooklyn. No one was injured.
https://t.co/7DgpTKXQiw

name: nytimes
text:
A tanker truck barreled through thousands of peaceful protesters in Minneapolis as the crowd rushed out of the way. The driver was arrested and officials said no one was hit, though some protesters told local media that they had seen people with injuries.
https://t.co/FohD5ehXFA https://t.co/E6hssu9yaQ

name: nytimes
text:
After a video of police cars ramming into a crowd of protestors in Brooklyn went viral, Mayor Bill de Blasio’s response highlighted his struggle to manage a crisis rooted in issues he’s long pledged to tackle: racism, police abuse and inequality.
https://t.co/mCVkNJ93j9

name: nytimes
text:
President Trump and several other political leaders have claimed that a radical agenda is to blame for turning once peaceful protests violent. But no one pointing fingers presented much evidence.
https://t.co/ByMFyAmmLd

name: nytimes
text: RT @maggieNYT: Trump advisers are discussing him doing something like  “listening sessions” to show he’s hearing concerns from the black community. https://t.co/bc9yKNdoA9 https://t.co/gBw0m7TvqF

name: nytimes
text: Thousands of people are marching in New York City during a fourth night of protests against racism and police violence. Follow along for live updates: https://t.co/eD0OxO7Rck https://t.co/DcIttvE7XF

name: nytimes
text: The election was clearly on President Trump's mind on Sunday. In response to questions about what he was doing to address the tumult, Trump forwarded a reply through an aide that focused on the campaign. “I’m going to win the election easily,” he said. https://t.co/sdZsbuAK1f

name: nytimes
text: Thousands of people are marching in New York City during a fourth night of protests against racism and police violence. Follow along for live updates: https://t.co/eD0OxNQfNK https://t.co/xjM1CWZsxE

name: nytimes
text:
New York Mayor Bill de Blasio's daughter, Chiara, was arrested around 10:30 p.m. on Saturday near Union Square in Manhattan, a police official said.

Follow live updates of the protests in New York: https://t.co/Bo6wZQfwRq

name: nytimes
text:
The New York Times front page for Monday, June 1.

The fury that has seized Minneapolis, where the death of George Floyd while in police custody set off days of protests, has swept across the country. For live updates: https://t.co/MfteDZdi0P https://t.co/2QZoe9gowq

name: nytimes
text: Videos showing police officers using batons, tear gas, pepper spray and rubber bullets on protesters, bystanders and journalists have highlighted the complaints about police behavior that have drawn protests in at least 75 cities across the U.S. https://t.co/NmDfOsgzzx

name: nytimes
text: RT @cegoldbaum: Things are getting tense at Barclays. Police pushed protesters down 4th ave, then surged into the crowd and made one arrest https://t.co/im5sqsWUNZThings are getting tense at Barclays. Police pushed protesters down 4th ave, then surged into the crowd and made on… https://t.co/omlJGXX4Vh

name: nytimes
text: A sheriff in Flint, Michigan, asked a crowd of demonstrators what he and other officers needed to do. The crowd chanted: “Walk with us." And so he did. https://t.co/27HNz3VnA1

name: nytimes
text: Images of burning NYPD vehicles set alight during protests have become the symbol of the unrest. Some protesters say the attacks reflect pent-up rage against a growing number of incidents of police brutality, while officials have denounced the violence. https://t.co/GHe12YO907

name: nytimes
text: Breaking news: Police fired tear gas at protesters who set fires near the White House as unrest continued in cities across America for a 6th consecutive night. Here’s the latest: https://t.co/iSU7z7NjZB https://t.co/QPuOVkKb6X

name: nytimes
text: After weeks of being cooped up to stay alive, thousands of New Yorkers have taken to the streets to protest the death of George Floyd. Here are images from 4 days of protest. https://t.co/K2o0SHbSKh https://t.co/4EDyhZL1ES

name: nytimes
text: RT @marclacey: It's hard to watch this. Really hard. But here's the most comprehensive reconstruct you'll find of what happened to George Floyd on that fateful afternoon last Monday: https://t.co/rCP2a2VJPD

name: nytimes
text: Thousands of protesters gathered in all 5 boroughs of New York City over the weekend. Many of the demonstrations have been peaceful, but numerous clashes between police officers and protesters have been caught on video and shared on social media. https://t.co/cWhUmh3byn https://t.co/W8eUNbAbaW

name: nytimes
text: The White House went dark as protesters set fires nearby and thousands again defied curfews to demonstrate against police brutality. Smoke was seen rising near the Washington Monument. https://t.co/pmtsjrQp7l https://t.co/ZSCAHrZxed

name: nytimes
text: The White House went dark, turning off almost all of its external lights, as protesters set fires nearby and thousands again defied curfews to demonstrate against police brutality. Smoke was seen rising near the Washington Monument. https://t.co/pmtsjrQp7l https://t.co/0twHpsWjPk

name: nytimes
text: RT @evanchill: What happened when George Floyd was killed in police custody on May 25? In our new video, we reconstruct the incident in detail, using security footage, witness videos, documents and scanner audio (This video contains scenes of graphic violence.) https://t.co/nM8CYBf7Xa

name: nytimes
text: When cities and states started urging people to wear masks to reduce transmission of the coronavirus, some made exceptions for exercising https://t.co/XtasFf0mcS

name: nytimes
text: Protests have erupted in at least 140 cities across the United States over racism and police brutality. Some of the demonstrations have turned violent, prompting the activation of the National Guard in at least 21 states. https://t.co/IgDntKt02K https://t.co/srpBanf3dS

name: nytimes
text: RT @damiencave: "People associated with both the extreme right and left are being accused of igniting the conflagration." Pretty much guarantees more division with each side blaming the other and sharing videos to confirm their biases. No idea how we break the cycle.  https://t.co/KGcOqlaGER

name: nytimes
text:
It was the 6th day of nationwide unrest in the U.S. since George Floyd was killed in police custody last week. Protesters defied curfews and several governors mobilized the National Guard.

For live updates: https://t.co/iSU7z84UR9 https://t.co/OAB1pRsEde

name: nytimes
text: Across Nicaragua, families are being forced to hold “express burials,” rushed funerals in such a haphazard fashion that relatives worry terrible mistakes are being made. “I don’t know that the person in that coffin was even him.” https://t.co/Ei92xbWfSM

text: Europe morning briefing: Here's what you need to know to start your day https://t.co/EBkOy7jBkE

text: RT @derek_m_norman: A police officer kneels with demonstrators at Barclays Center in Brooklyn. https://t.co/8DMb34s35b

name: nytimes
text: A judge has ruled that Sally Challen, a British woman who was convicted of killing her husband after decades of emotional abuse, is entitled to the family’s estate https://t.co/MUFq3DLD40

name: nytimes
text: China and its allies are using threats and pressure to get business to back Beijing’s increasingly hard-line stance toward Hong Kong, leading companies to muzzle or intimidate workers who speak out in protest https://t.co/4kOdoSn1Sh

name: nytimes
text: Taiwan’s constitutional court struck down an 85-year-old law that made adultery a crime punishable by up to a year in prison https://t.co/u08aVnUkDn

name: nytimes
text: The Czech Republic loosened its lockdown earlier than most countries. That has made it a laboratory for how arts and culture can adapt to a situation in which some restrictions on social life have been lifted, while others remain in place. https://t.co/qsp9NwQlIm
